question.text:
Statement I: Flower is an aggregation of sporophylls.

Statement II: Sporophylls are modified in angiosperms.

Choose the correct answer based on the above statements.

options.text: Both statement I and statement II are true and statement II is a correct explanation of statement I
Both statement I and statement II are true but statement II is not a correct explanation of statement I
Statement I is true but statement II is false
Both statement I and statement II are false

solution.text: In angiosperm, sporophylls are organised into flowers. Both microsporophylls and megasporophylls are specialised. A microsporophyll or stamen consists of a filament and an anther. A megasporophyll or carpel is rolled and partly sterilised to produce a stigma, style and ovary containing ovules.
